DataElement.preferredName: Investigator Study Research Personnel Role Postal Address ISO21090.AD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A researcher in a study who oversees multiple aspects of the study, such as concept development, protocol writing, protocol submission for IRB approval, participant recruitment, informed consent, data collection, analysis, interpretation and presentation. A contact point used to send physical forms of communication to the study personnel.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigator Study Research Personnel Role Postal Address
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individual who conducts scientific research. In a clinical setting this individual actually conducts and/or supervises the clinical investigation and study-related procedures.  The investigator monitors the safety of the trial subjects and investigational staff (under whose immediate direction an agent is administered or dispensed to a subject).  The investigator collects and analyses data and study documents, and provides reports in compliance with applicable requirements.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:People engaged in research.:The usual or expected function of something; the part something plays in an action or event._Of or relating to the system for delivering mail.:A standardized representation of the location of a person, business, building, or organization.
